main event: A bright, controlled object was observed descending towards the Harvard Square Bridge in Cambridge, Massachusetts on September 9, 1964. The object illuminated the area and then suddenly shot up at high speed, disappearing from sight.
interesting points: The object had several flashing or blinking lights on its surface and changed color from white to orange/red during its flight.
Other motorists in the area also observed the object and it was reported to the Air Force, who initiated an investigation.
A second object was observed near Fenway Park, described as flat with bright lights, that accelerated rapidly and climbed vertically out of sight.
A TV-radio station crew also witnessed the object, describing it as round in shape with a reddish glow, that hovered and then moved off at high speed.
The report includes a sketch or diagram of an oval-shaped, metallic object that was hovering and flashing a light on and off.
sighted object: a bright, controlled object and a flat object with bright lights
witnesses: multiple civilian witnesses, including an engineering student, motorists, and a TV-radio station crew
